answerText: Sapphic Stanza[10] This Sappho poem begs the title goddess to "abate my torment" and to "fight as my comrade" and describes how that goddess had earlier visited the speaker and asked who the cause of her anguish was.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 2 | 4 | Literature | Other | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Horace used this form for his ode, "Integer Vitae." For 10 points each: [10] Name this form frequently employed in classical literature. Its stanzas consist of three hendecasyllabic lines followed by a fourth, five-syllable line called an "Adonic."
